page.title: 08Vogrie Country Park
page.content: Vogrie Country Park was opened in 1980 and is visited regularly by families, wild-life enthusiasts, and school parties. It is a nature reserve and has many interesting features including a large variety of trees,flowers and interesting wildlife. Animals such as badgers, squirrels, stoats and hedgehogs live in the wooded areas. The River Tyne threads it's way through the valley. There is an exiting children's adventure playground and an attractive picnic area with facilities for barbecuing. It is an extremely popular park and has thousands of visitors during the year. There is an open day each summer which attracts many visitors. Vogrie House, built in 1875,is now a historial building and crafts centre
